summary: This is an email chain between US Attorney's Office (SDNY) prosecutors discussing sending a 'friendly subpoena' to an attorney (IM) to obtain a copy of a settlement agreement between a victim and Jeffrey Epstein. The agreement resolved a 2009 civil suit and is sought for the ongoing investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell's participation in abuse.

persons.name: Audrey
persons.context: A prosecutor at the US Attorney's Office (SDNY) who needs to approve the subpoena request.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the ongoing investigation into her participation in the abuse of victims, for which the settlement agreement is sought as relevant evidence.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The defendant in the 2009 civil suit which was resolved by the settlement agreement being subpoenaed.

connections.description: IM possesses the settlement agreement that resolved a civil suit against Epstein.
Maxwell is under investigation for participation in abuse connected to Epstein.
IM is cooperating by providing documents and has indicated he will provide the settlement agreement upon receipt of a subpoena.

events.title: Civil suit against Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A civil lawsuit was filed against Jeffrey Epstein by a victim, which was later resolved by a settlement agreement.

events.title: Discussion of friendly subpoena
events.description: Prosecutors discuss sending a 'friendly subpoena' to attorney IM to obtain the Epstein settlement agreement for the Maxwell investigation.

keyFacts: A settlement agreement exists that resolved a 2009 civil suit against Jeffrey Epstein.
Attorney IM possesses this settlement agreement and is willing to provide it to prosecutors but believes he needs a subpoena.
The US Attorney's Office (SDNY) is seeking the agreement as relevant evidence in the ongoing investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell's participation in abuse.
The email discusses procedural details about issuing the subpoena, including checking for protective orders and specifying the request.
The document indicates prior cooperation, as IM's firm had already voluntarily provided other court filings and deposition transcripts from the civil case.
